inn1.comm: Lee runs in and bowls a gentle short of a length ball, by his standards, around leg stump, and Tharanga works it away on the leg side
142.4 kph length delivery, didn't look like that the way it came off the pitch slowly, Tharanga in fact waited on it before plonking it down close on the off side
Lee goes fuller across the left-hander and Tharanga is away, pushing out to guide it wide of point, and wide of third man as well
tests out what the pitch has, bangs in a bouncer, Tharanga is taken by surprise and goes under it
this one is on the stumps from just short of a length, tucks Tharanga up, and he opens the face to play it out to point
the short of a length ball arrives, not the bouncer, and tharanga easily keeps it down for Lee to field it
immediately troubles Dilshan with extra pace and bounce, he went for his favourite slap-punch through the off side, got an outside edge that flew wide of second slip, and beat third man as well

throws the bait at Dilshan with a full and swinging delivery outside off stump, Dilshan knows only one way to deal with baits, he takes them on gleefully, but the away movement beats his airy attempted drive
down the pads now off a full length, he misses out on the flick, that should have been put away

Tait has won this short but searing battle, Dilshan was on the crease, maybe expecting a bouncer, it was that bait again, moving away from a length outside off, Dilshan threw everything at it, and the edge flew at a comfortable height to White at second slip, Tait is pumped up, really is
full and coming in to the batsman, Sanga goes tentatively half forward and gets it towards midwicket to get off strike, wise move
149.5 kph ripper that thuds into Tharanga's defensive bat and rolls away without harm on the off side, this is super stuff from Tait
Sanga gets going, drives Lee with minimum of effort through cover, it was just short of a length  and he eased it in to the gap, just the man Sri Lanka need right now
Tharanga gets one in his zone, wide and short outside off stump, cuts on the bounce to point
109.1 kph slower one from Lee, but goes wrong completely, pitches outside leg and moves further away down the leg side
gets it on target this time, on a length going across Tharanga, who gets forward and pushes it wide of extra cover
dug in short of a length, sitting up on this track, punched away nicely to extra cover
Sanga comes right forward to meet this one coming in from a length outside off, shows the full face of the bat, and holds the pose as the ball races past mid on
Sanga is looking good, uses the angle from round the stumps to whip this length delivery wide of mid on, Lee has yet to find his radar
stands in the crease as this short of a length ball comes off lazily off the pitch, and punches it wide of mid off
bowls the bouncer, tharanga thinks it can be carved over point, but was late on the shot
another bouncer, higher this time, 147.2 kph, tharanga goes underneath it hurriedly
they steal a single as Tharanga drops this one in front of point
Sanga wanted to send this length ball through cover, he bent the knee and went for the drive, but got an inside edge that flew past the stumps to fine leg
right on the money is Tait, length ball on the stumps, Tharanga blocks resolutely
Lee starts off well in this over, just short of a length into Sanga who brings it down close to the stumps
late decision to guide this one, he was rooted to the crease, saw this one going across him, and at the last instant brought down the bat to play it away to point
144.6 kph and hurrying on to Sanga who pushes too hard at it, and it travels fast to mid off, and Tharanga has to rush back in to his crease
no room to make use of the pace, Sanga tries to guide it past point but cannot
Sanga pushes this one softer to mid off than the one earlier this over, and goes scurrying across for the single, Ponting fires in the throw, Sanga was home with the clumsy dive in the end
cut away off the back foot to cover, too much bounce for Tharanga's liking
the friendlier pace is to the batsman's liking, he can get the front foot out, and guides it wide of point
fuller from Watto, and he is coming on to the front foot and driving it wide of mid off, what a difference a few yards of pace make
shot! Sanga has had enough of being pegged on the back foot, comes forward and stylishly slams this full delivery in the tiniest of gaps past cover
whoa, pushes this one and takes off at the same time, Watson got to the ball, and Sanga had to go back hastily
goes for another carve through covers but checks the shot at the last moment, short cover and short extra cover are playing on his mind
length ball pushed down the ground to mid off
Tharanga gets away, he was very late in bringing an angled bat down on a length ball around off stump, and got an inside edge on to pad that rolled away on the off side
just short of a length, enough for Sanga to work it past square leg
short one on leg stump, he goes outside the line and tries to turn it past a very short short fine leg, but he puts in the dive to stop a certain boundary

what a take! Tharanga cannot believe it, it was that short and wide delivery that he likes to take toll of, but it bounced a shade too much for his comfort, tand he cut it in the air past point, or thought he had, but Steve Smith there pulled off a stunner, timing his leap at full stretch to perfection, taking it one handed, he juggled with it somewhat before taking it cleanly in the end, that ball was really traveling like a bullet, if not a 'tracer' bullet
goes in search of the yorker but sprays it down the leg side
pacy length delivery that makes Mahela come out and block solidly
they had removed the second slip some time ago, the edge from Mahela flies at catchable height in that direction, it was angled in from a length, and Mahela went prodding at it, getting a thick edge
played down the ground to mid off
flicked off the pads to fine leg

Sanga caught in two minds, if not more, went across and in the end pushed outside the line of one going across him, was he looking to run it to third man, was he looking to leave it, survives nevertheless
Watsone gets the outside edge, but it flies through a vacant slip cordon and wide of third man to the boundary, it was a length ball going across Sanga and he went for the drive off the front foot
played away on the off side
in the channel outside off stump, now he leaves with a flourish
goes wide and across Mahela with a short of a length ball with his slinging action
and Mahela almost gives it to them, goes driving at a fuller one from the crease, that was not far from the edge, Haddin knows it
a touch shorter and Mahela sees it early, and decides to leave it
Mitch's turn to check out the bounce on this pitch, gives it the full shoulder, and that takes it high over Mahela, too high in fact
Mahela turns this straight one on the stumps towards midwicket, Johnson goes after it, and concedes an overthrow as he has a go at the non-striker's end
squares him up with one bowled at that uncomfortable angle and bounce, he manages to push it away to backward point
wider outside off stump this time, Mahela has had enough adventure for the over, and leaves it alone
length ball on middle, Sanga goes forward and turns it to midwicket who lets it slip away
flicked away fine, it was one leg stump, Mahela went across and turned it with those lovely wrists, no chance for fine leg
comes forward and blocks this one on the off side
this one comes in off a length around off, Mahela arrests the forward movement and turns it past square leg, and comes back hard for the second
he gets bounce from a length outside off, Mahela decides to go for the cut, is beaten by the extra lift, and Haddin gathers neatly
defended solidly off the back foot in to the off side
goes full and wide down the leg side with the angle from over the wicket
meets this full delivery with a confident forward push and the ball goes towards short midwicket
tries to dab this shortish one away wide of point but cannot get the placement right

lovely push-drive from Sanga, how good is that for timing, it was a length delivery some way outside off, Sanga brought the bat down nice and straight, bisected the gap between mid off and mid on, both of whom gave up the chase early
turned away to mid on off the front foot, looking for that push-drive again
played out towards covers
he is so quick to get on that front foot, spots the length quickly and pushes it back to the bowler
144 kph low full toss swinging in to the pads, flicked away through square leg
144.8 kph bouncer that makes Sanga go underneath it, it dies on its way to the keeper
back of a length just outside off stump, and he stays in the crease to push it past cover
short of a length delivery on the stumps, Mahela goes on the back foot and blocks on the leg side

Mahela's brand of non-violence brings him a boundary, got forward to this length delivery and eased it in the gap between extra cover ad mid off, from where Lee went chasing it desperately all the way to the ropes, he even put in a dive in the end but it eluded him
angled furiously in to the pads, Mahela misses on the flick and Tait goes up in appeal, but that was going down leg
rolls away fine off the pads, Haddin puts in the dive to collect it, Mahela wills Sanga in to the run
pushed away in front of midwicket and they take on Clarke who scores a direct hit but the batsman is safely home
good running, pushed in front of mid off and now Sanga takes on the throw, easily gets it in the end
Mahela goes tall to bring down this short one in front of cover, and the duo steal yet another single from Australia
131.6 short delivery, comes in sharply off the wicket to strike him on the shoulder, Sanga looks surprised, did it hit a crack? was it the off cutter? hard to tell, maybe bit of both
pushed away to point off the back foot
149.3 kph full delivery on the stumps, Mahela flicks it past midwicket
short delivery banged in, a bit misdirected, goes down the leg side, Mahela goes under
the Mahela defence, makes even relative inaction look beautiful, high elbow, the ball thuds into bat and rolls away harmlessly on the off side
good bounce again, turned away off the pads towards square leg
bangs it in short of a length, not a very good idea on this wicket, he defends easily
waits for this one to come on outside off stump and guides it to point
good length outside off stump, Mahela beats the fielder at cover with a gentle push off the front foot
good length and straight from Johnson, Sangakkara gets behind the line and drives towards mid-on
Sangakkara is taking a bit of a risk, moving across his stumps to clip a good length ball from middle stump towards midwicket
and again, Sangakkara walks across his stumps and flicks a good length ball from middle towards deep square ... if he misses ...
and again, the step across the stumps and the flick towards midwicket
outside off stump from Johnson this time, so Sangakkara waits in his crease and opens the face to steer the ball towards third man
good length, angling across the left-hander. Sangakkara dabs the ball towards third man

Smith has run out Mahela, and that is a massive moment in this match. Mahela pushed the ball towards cover point and set off for the run. He saw Steve Smith, who took that stupendous catch, swooping on the ball and hesitated a fraction. Sangakkara had responded to the run so Mahela decided to go for it. Smith picked up cleanly and let loose a throw that clipped the top of the stumps at the bowler's end. Mahela was several inches short. Sangakkara had also hesitated a touch, and Mahela was looking at the fielder as he ran, which could have reduced his speed. Silence at the Premadasa.
played on the leg side
Sangakkara stays in his crease and blocks
played towards cover
Sangakkara moves a touch towards the off and cuts towards third man
tossed up on middle and off from round the wicket, dabbed from the crease towards point
Krejza turns the ball away from Sangakkara after pitching on off, played off the back foot on the off side
a touch shorter outside off and Sangakkara goes back to cut the ball hard and in the air through cover point
Krejza slants the ball across the right-hander from round the wicket and zips it back into him from outside off. Lots of turn there. Murali, are you watching? Samaraweera lets it go
the offbreak outside off, Samaraweera defends
played off the pads behind square for a single ... Ponting had brought a silly point in for that final ball
short of a length angling into the right-hander, tucked off the body towards long leg
good length outside off, dabbed towards third man from the crease
played off the back foot towards cover
Watson nips the ball from a good length outside off into the right-hander, cramping Samaraweera for room
Watson unleashes the bouncer, but it's a slower one. Samaraweera played the pull too early and didn't make contact
short of a length delivery angling into the rib cage, Samaraweera moves across and plays it behind square
Samaraweera tries to drive through the off but the turn into him from around the wicket causes an inside edge on the leg side
Krejza spun the ball down leg and Samaraweera had come a long way forward and was beaten. He got his foot just behind the line before Haddin took off the bails
that kept low as well, pulled off the back foot
Sangakkara strides forward and defends
short ball around off stump, cut off the back foot towards cover
pushed off the front foot towards cover
Krejza pitches outside off and turns it away from Sanga who gets on to the front foot and plays no shot
that's a fine yorker and Samaraweera does well to dig it out through square leg
Sanga tries to use the width outside off to cut towards third man but gets beaten. Haddin completes a sharp take.
good length delivery from over the wicket, angling across the left-hander. Sangakkara defends from off stump towards cover
a touch shorter and Sangakkara cuts off the back foot towards deep point. They were going back for the second when Samaraweera slipped and had to turn back and scramble
tucked off the hips towards square leg
full ball outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards long off
flight from Krejza, bowling round the wicket, pitching on middle. Sangakkara leans forward and clips the ball towards midwicket
Samaraweera strides forward and nudges the ball off his pads towards square. Haddin sprints to do the fielding
lots of flight outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards long off
Samaraweera goes deep into his crease and budges the ball behind square
shot! A boundary after a while. Sangakkara got down on one knee, waited for the flighted ball to pitch around off, and swatted it with power into the gap at deep midwicket
played towards long off for a single
played from the crease towards mid off, tight line and length from Watson
a good length delivery pitching in line with the stumps and angling just outside off, Sangakkara stays in his crease and blocks
identical ball to the previous one, Sangakkara tries to dab it behind point but doesn't find the gap

a bit straighter from Watson and Sangakkara nudges it behind square and takes the single to reach fifty. The Premadasa crowd gives him a huge cheer. They want him to score a century. He hasn't scored one since 2008.

an appeal from Watson as Samaraweera strides forward and gets hit on the front pad by a good length delivery that nips into the right-hander. Did it strike the pad just outside off? It did, just about. Australia's review against the not-out decision is unsuccessful.
Watson pitches the ball on a good length outside off and nips it back into Samaraweera, who stays in his crease and defends this time
Sangakkara plays the ball towards deep point for a single
Samaraweera goes deep into his crease and plays the ball on the on side
Samaraweera moves forward and drives a full ball towards long-on
Sanga dabs the ball off the front foot behind square and sets off, Haddin sprints towards the ball and Samaraweera sends Sangakkara back
cut hard off the back foot towards cover
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
defended on the front foot with bat and pad close together
that drifted in a touch and turned away from Samaraweera, who let the ball go. Lots of flight
Sri Lanka reach hundred with a cover drive from Samaraweera through the in field
big turn for Smith after he pitches just outside off and rips it into the left-hander, after slanting the ball across him. Sangakkara gets hit on the pad
played towards square leg for one
tossed up wide outside off, Samaraweera reaches out for it and drives towards the fielder on the sweeper boundary
dangerous shot with a slip in place. Samaraweera backs away to make room and cuts an offbreak past the fielder at first slip
nudged off the pads towards midwicket for a single
defended watchfully on the front foot towards point
punched off the back foot towards long off
nudged off the pads behind square for a single
flighted delivery on off stump, Sangakara stays in his crease and punches towards extra cover. The fielder at cover tries to cut it off but ends up pushing the ball towards mid-off
nudged off the pads behind square for a single
driven inside out from the crease towards cover
flighted ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards long off
tossed up outside off stump, defended on the front foot towards point
punched off the back foot towards long on
Sangakkara skips down the track and hits the ball flat towards wide long-on with a graceful golf-swing
Sangakkara played the ball towards cover and Samaraweera set off for the run. Smith fielded the ball and Sangakkara sent Samaraweera back. but Smith fumbled and a run-out was missed
beaten by the off break outside off
played towards cover for a single
tossed up slowly on off and middle, Samaraweera came forward, waited for a bit, and then defended
played with the turn from the crease through the leg side
Krejza drifts the ball into the left-hander and spins it away, Sangakkara pushes forward and edges towards the off
smith tosses the ball up outside off and spins it away, Samaraweera lets it go
this time he cuts towards deep point for a single
played towards midwicket from the crease
pushed off the front foot towards long-off
Samaraweera goes back in his crease and cuts the ball towards backward point
he goes back again and cuts harder, towards the fielder on the sweeper boundary
good length ball but a touch wide outside off, Samaraweera plays the ball towards point
the yorker but Samaraweera is up for it and digs it out on the off side for a quick single
good length, angling into Sangakkara from round the wicket. Defended on the back foot towards the bowler with a straight bat
Tait strays on to the pads and Sangakkara glances the ball towards long leg
this time he strays on to Samaraweera's pads and the batsman closes the face so late to nudge the ball past Haddin towards the boundary
better line, around off stump, Samaraweera defends on the back foot towards the off side
angles the ball into Sanga's pads from round the wicket, flicked fluently towards deep square leg and that single brings up the 50 partnership
Lee tails the ball from a good length into the right-hander, Samaraweera punches the ball towards Lee off the front foot
a nice friendly full toss on middle stump, Samaraweera flicks the ball towards deep square
that kept rather low and it was headed for middle stump before Samaraweera clipped it behind square
short of a length outside off, played awkwardly off the back foot towards point
good length and very straight, Samaraweera moves back and across and pushes towards the leg side
tossed up, he comes forward and pushes wide of point, there was a mix-up but the throw was late to the non-striker's end
lovely flight, good turn from outside off, Sanga plays it with an open face on the off side
touch shorter, looks to punch it down the ground, but mistimes it in to the ground
floats it up wide outside off, it turns away sharply, he has a look at it and lets it go
drives this fuller delivery  to long off
flighted outside off stump, he pushed forward tentatively and picks up a single as the ball rolls away towards cover
drive with the turn wide of point
full on the stumps, swept away to fine leg
tossed up very full, he stays beside the line and drives inside out to extra cover, good player of spin, Thilan
follows this wide delivery that turns away a long way, manages to dab it away fine on the off side
gift, full toss around off stump, Sanga happily whacks it wide of deep midwicket
now he drops it marginally short, and is pulled away to deep square leg
turning away from Sanga, who waits for it to go away, and cuts it away to sweeper cover
goes forward to a flighted ball, and Sri Lanka get away with another mix-up, Thilan hurries back in to his crease
Sanga gets one full down the leg side, and sweeps it very fine, too fine for fine leg
shortish and turning away, cut away to sweeper cover off the back foot

goes for the forward defensive, was it pad first, was it bat, Krejza asks the question in hope, Ponting seems more confident, goes for the review right away as the appeal is turned down, replays show the ball was going to miss leg stump with all that turn on offer, Australia lose their last review
